meanings.definition: An entrance or passage leading to a mine.
meanings.sent1: The miners entered the adit to start their shift underground.
meanings.sent2: The adit provided a safe way for workers to access the mine.
meanings.sent3: The adit was so narrow that only one person could enter at a time.
meanings.sent4: The adit beckoned like a dark portal into the depths of the earth.
meanings.sent5: The adit's entrance was marked by a sturdy wooden door.

meanings.definition: A horizontal passage leading into a mine for the purposes of access or drainage.
meanings.sent1: Water flowed out of the adit, keeping the mine dry.
meanings.sent2: The adit was dug straight into the hillside for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The adit was so well-built that it doubled as a secret hideout.
meanings.sent4: The adit's cool air was a welcome relief from the heat outside.
meanings.sent5: The adit's walls were lined with tools for the miners' use.
